sentences.en: Can even our Ministers sustain a more humiliating disgrace?
sentences.cn: 我们的各位部长大人是否还能容忍这样的屈辱.

sentences.en: He was thinking of his long, humiliating confession.
sentences.cn: 他正想着他那篇长长的, 羞辱的自供.

sentences.en: It was humiliating for him to be treated like a child!
sentences.cn: 他被当作三岁孩子看待,真是丢脸.

sentences.en: It was humiliating that he did so ill something which seemed contemptible.
sentences.cn: 让他做这些在他看来是无聊的事儿,而且他还干得很不好,这真是莫大耻辱.

sentences.en: It was so humiliating, a terrible blow to my self-esteem.
sentences.cn: 这件事如此丢脸，深深地挫伤了我的自尊心。

sentences.en: It's humiliating to be sent here for crafts and cold baths.
sentences.cn: 来这里搞诡计真的令我感到羞辱.

sentences.en: On the other hand , beating a quiet retreat would would be far too humiliating.
sentences.cn: 就这么老老实实的出去,又十分的不是味儿.

sentences.en: The battle ended in a humiliating defeat.
sentences.cn: 这场战役以耻辱的失败告终.

sentences.en: The job had become reduced quickly to its onerous humiliating routine.
sentences.cn: 他的工作很快就缩小到只剩些烦琐的例行公事,干着也觉得很不光彩.

sentences.en: The results of the poll dealt a humiliating rebuff to Mr Jones.
sentences.cn: 民意调查的结果对琼斯先生很不利，让他颜面尽失。

sentences.en: They forecast a humiliating defeat for the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 他们预言首相将遭遇惨败。

sentences.en: They inflicted a humiliating defeat on the home team.
sentences.cn: 他们使主队吃了一场很没面子的败仗。

sentences.en: To be puffed by ignorance was not only humiliating, but perilous.
sentences.cn: 无知者的吹捧不仅使人感到可耻, 也是危险的.

sentences.en: When they got back to their little apartment, Marie made a humiliating discovery. She couldn't cook!
sentences.cn: 当他们回到狭小的寓所时, 玛丽发现自己竟不会烧菜. 这令她感到非常的羞愧!

sentences.en: You know how many humiliating experiences before I thought of that?
sentences.cn: 在想到这主意之前你知道有多少回羞辱的事情 么 ?

words.tran_cn: 屈辱（humiliate的过去式）；使…丢脸，使…蒙羞

trans.tran_en: making you feel ashamed, embarrassed, and angry because you have been made to look weak or stupid
